channel.title: Dpkg: error while processing a package libreoffice-common installed post-installation script returned error code 10
channel.description:
Errors when installing libreoffice
sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install --no-install-recommends libreoffice-writer libreoffice-calc
``` dpkg: error processing package libreoffice-common (--configure): subprocess from package libreoffice-common post-installation script returned error code 10 dpkg: dependencies prevent packages from being configured
dpkg: error processing package libreoffice-core (--configure): dependency problems – leaving unconfigured dpkg: dependencies prevent package libreoffice-calc from being configured: libreoffice-calc depends on libreoffice-common (>= 1:7.0.0~alpha~), but: The package libreoffice-common is not yet configured. libreoffice-calc depends on libreoffice-core (= 4:7.4.7-1+deb12u9), but: The package libreoffice-core is not yet configured.
dpkg: error processing package libreoffice-calc (--configure): dependency problems – leaving unconfigured dpkg: dependencies prevent package libreoffice-writer from being configured: libreoffice-writer depends on libreoffice-common (>= 1:7.0.0~alpha~), but: The package libreoffice-common is not yet configured. libreoffice-writer depends on libreoffice-core (= 4:7.4.7-1+deb12u9), but: The package libreoffice-core is not yet configured.
dpkg: error processing package libreoffice-writer (--configure): dependency problems – leaving unconfigured dpkg: dependencies prevent package libreoffice-base-core from being configured: libreoffice-base-core depends on libreoffice-core-nogui (= 4:7.4.7-1+deb12u9) | libreoffice-core (= 4:7.4.7-1+deb12u9), but: The package libreoffice-core-nogui is not installed. The package libreoffice-core is not yet configured.
dpkg: error processing package libreoffice-base-core (--configure): dependency problems – leaving unconfigured Processing triggers for fontconfig (2.14.1-4) … Processing triggers for desktop-file-utils (0.26-1) … Processing triggers for hicolor-icon-theme (0.17-2) … Processing triggers for gnome-menus (3.36.0-1.1) … Processing triggers for libc-bin (2.36-9+deb12u13) … Processing triggers for man-db (2.11.2-2) … Processing triggers for shared-mime-info (2.2-1) … Processing triggers for security-misc (3:47.0-1) … INFO: triggered security-misc: 'security-misc' security-misc DPKG_MAINTSCRIPT_NAME: 'postinst' $*: 'triggered /usr' 2: '/usr' /usr/libexec/security-misc/mmap-rnd-bits: INFO: Successfully written ASLR map config file: /etc/sysctl.d/30_security-misc_aslr-mmap.conf Running SUID Disabler and Permission Hardener... See also: https://www.kicksecure.com/wiki/SUID_Disabler_and_Permission_Hardener /var/lib/dpkg/info/security-misc.postinst: INFO: running: permission-hardener enable permission-hardener: [NOTICE]: Executing: setcap -r /bin/ping permission-hardener: [NOTICE]: To compare the current and previous permission modes, install 'meld' (or preferred diff tool) for comparison of file mode changes: sudo apt install --no-install-recommends meld meld /var/lib/permission-hardener-v2/existing_mode/statoverride /var/lib/permission-hardener-v2/new_mode/statoverride /var/lib/dpkg/info/security-misc.postinst: INFO: Permission hardening success. Processing triggers for mailcap (3.70+nmu1) … Errors occurred while processing the following packages: libreoffice-common libreoffice-core libreoffice-calc libreoffice-writer libreoffice-base-core
```
sudo dpkg --configure -a
sudo apt --fix-broken install
the same error appears when entering these commands.
I cannot install libreoffice on a working system

item.title: Dpkg: error while processing a package libreoffice-common installed post-installation script returned error code 10
item.dc:creator: arraybolt3
item.description:
I think you missed the part of the logs that actually shows the problem. The libreoffice package probably printed what went wrong immediately above the subprocess from package libreoffice-common post-installation script returned error code 10 line. Can you share the full output you get from apt? There’s no need to omit parts for the sake of brevity.

Read full topic
item.source: Dpkg: error while processing a package libreoffice-common installed post-installation script returned error code 10

item.title: Dpkg: error while processing a package libreoffice-common installed post-installation script returned error code 10
item.dc:creator: SpecialBook
item.description:
Errors when installing libreoffice

sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install --no-install-recommends libreoffice-writer libreoffice-calc

dpkg: error processing package libreoffice-common (--configure):
 subprocess from package libreoffice-common post-installation script returned error code 10
dpkg: dependencies prevent packages from being configured

dpkg: error processing package libreoffice-core (--configure):
 dependency problems – leaving unconfigured
dpkg: dependencies prevent package libreoffice-calc from being configured:
 libreoffice-calc depends on libreoffice-common (>= 1:7.0.0~alpha~), but:
   The package libreoffice-common is not yet configured.
 libreoffice-calc depends on libreoffice-core (= 4:7.4.7-1+deb12u9), but:
   The package libreoffice-core is not yet configured.

dpkg: error processing package libreoffice-calc (--configure):
 dependency problems – leaving unconfigured
dpkg: dependencies prevent package libreoffice-writer from being configured:
 libreoffice-writer depends on libreoffice-common (>= 1:7.0.0~alpha~), but:
   The package libreoffice-common is not yet configured.
 libreoffice-writer depends on libreoffice-core (= 4:7.4.7-1+deb12u9), but:
   The package libreoffice-core is not yet configured.

dpkg: error processing package libreoffice-writer (--configure):
 dependency problems – leaving unconfigured
dpkg: dependencies prevent package libreoffice-base-core from being configured:
 libreoffice-base-core depends on libreoffice-core-nogui (= 4:7.4.7-1+deb12u9) | libreoffice-core (= 4:7.4.7-1+deb12u9), but:
   The package libreoffice-core-nogui is not installed.
   The package libreoffice-core is not yet configured.

dpkg: error processing package libreoffice-base-core (--configure):
 dependency problems – leaving unconfigured
Processing triggers for fontconfig (2.14.1-4) …
Processing triggers for desktop-file-utils (0.26-1) …
Processing triggers for hicolor-icon-theme (0.17-2) …
Processing triggers for gnome-menus (3.36.0-1.1) …
Processing triggers for libc-bin (2.36-9+deb12u13) …
Processing triggers for man-db (2.11.2-2) …
Processing triggers for shared-mime-info (2.2-1) …
Processing triggers for security-misc (3:47.0-1) …
INFO: triggered security-misc: 'security-misc' security-misc DPKG_MAINTSCRIPT_NAME: 'postinst' $*: 'triggered /usr' 2: '/usr'
/usr/libexec/security-misc/mmap-rnd-bits: INFO: Successfully written ASLR map config file:
/etc/sysctl.d/30_security-misc_aslr-mmap.conf
Running SUID Disabler and Permission Hardener... See also:
https://www.kicksecure.com/wiki/SUID_Disabler_and_Permission_Hardener
/var/lib/dpkg/info/security-misc.postinst: INFO: running: permission-hardener enable
permission-hardener: [NOTICE]: Executing: setcap -r /bin/ping
permission-hardener: [NOTICE]: To compare the current and previous permission modes, install 'meld' (or preferred diff tool) for comparison of file mode changes:
    sudo apt install --no-install-recommends meld
    meld /var/lib/permission-hardener-v2/existing_mode/statoverride /var/lib/permission-hardener-v2/new_mode/statoverride
/var/lib/dpkg/info/security-misc.postinst: INFO: Permission hardening success.
Processing triggers for mailcap (3.70+nmu1) …
Errors occurred while processing the following packages:
 libreoffice-common
 libreoffice-core
 libreoffice-calc
 libreoffice-writer
 libreoffice-base-core

sudo dpkg --configure -a

sudo apt --fix-broken install

the same error appears when entering these commands.

I cannot install libreoffice on a working system
